verbose_text: In this scheme (XREF_FIG), we propose that blockade of NET by cocaine promotes activation of G q/11 -coupled alpha 1 Rs and this, together with mGluR1 activation, initiates 2-AG release, which then suppresses GABA release to disinhibit (K) Pre-treatment of slices with thapsigargin (2 muM) significantly attenuates the inhibition of GABA B IPSCs by cocaine (n = 7; * p < 0.05, unpaired t test).
evidence: 2-AG release, which then suppresses GABA release to disinhibit (K) Pre-treatment of slices with thapsigargin (2 muM) significantly attenuates the inhibition of GABA
